member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.EncryptionException
member.summary: An EncryptionException should be thrown for any problems related to encryption, hashing, or digital signatures.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.EnterpriseSecurityException
member.summary: EnterpriseSecurityException is the base class for all security related exceptions. You should pass in the root cause exception where possible. Constructors for classes extending EnterpriseSecurityException should be sure to call the appropriate base constructor in order to ensure that logging and intrusion detection occur properly.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.EnterpriseSecurityException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of EnterpriseSecurityException. This exception is automatically logged, so that simply by using this API, applications will generate an extensive security log. In addition, this exception is automatically registrered with the IntrusionDetector, so that quotas can be checked.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.EnterpriseSecurityException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of EnterpriseSecurityException that includes a root cause Throwable.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.EncryptionException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of EncryptionException.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IValidationRule
member.summary: A class that implements IValidationRule performs validation of a single piece of data from an untrusted source.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IValidationRule.IsValid(System.String)
member.summary: Returns boolean value indicating whether input is considered valid.
member.returns: True, if input value is valid. False, otherwise.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.ValidationRules.DoubleValidationRule.IsValid(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the input is a valid double.
member.returns: True, if the input is valid. False, otherwise.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Randomizer
member.summary: Reference implemenation of the interface. This implementation builds on the MSCAPI provider to provide a cryptographically strong source of entropy. The specific algorithm used is configurable in the ESAPI properties.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IRandomizer
member.summary: The IRandomizer interface defines a set of methods for creating cryptographically random numbers and strings.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Randomizer.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates the class, with the apropriate algorithm.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IHttpUtilities
member.summary: The IHttpUtilities interface is a collection of methods that provide additional security related to HTTP requests, responses, sessions, cookies, headers, and logging.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IHttpUtilities.AddCsrfToken
member.summary: This method adds a CSRF token to all POST requests, automatically. This method should be called in a filter or front controller that is called for every request. Since POST requests are generally not idempotent, they should always be protected from CSRF. GET requests should follow an opt-in model for CSRF protection - see .

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IHttpUtilities.AddCsrfToken(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a CSRF token to the URL for purposes of preventing CSRF attacks. This should be used for pages which accept GET requests and are not idempotent (have lasting side effects). This should work in correlation with the method. This method is an opt-in way to specify pages which accept GET requests and need to be protected against CSRF.
member.param: The URL to which the CSRF token will be appended
member.returns: The updated URL with the CSRF token parameter added

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IHttpUtilities.VerifyCsrfToken
member.summary: This method verifies that the request has the appropriate CSRF tokens.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IHttpUtilities.AddNoCacheHeaders
member.summary: This method is used to add HTTP headers to prevent caching. This protects against sensitive information being left in the client-side browser cache.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IHttpUtilities.ChangeSessionIdentifier
member.summary: This method changes the session identifier, while leaving the underlying session data consistent.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IHttpUtilities.AssertSecureRequest(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary: Ensure request is secure (over SSL and using POST)

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.RuntimeEventBridge
member.summary: Base class to forward runtime events

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.RuntimeEventBridge.BeforeForwardEvent(System.EventHandler{Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.RuntimeEventArgs},System.Object,Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.RuntimeEventArgs)
member.summary: Before event is forwarded template method
member.param: Handler to which the event is forwarded
member.returns: True if event handled (not forwarded necessary), false otherwise
member.remarks: Override to prevent event forwarding

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.RuntimeEventBridge.AfterForwardEvent(System.EventHandler{Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.RuntimeEventArgs},System.Object,Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.RuntimeEventArgs)
member.param: Handler to which the event is forwarded
member.remarks: Override to be called after the event is forwarded

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.RuntimeEventBridge.ForwardEventFault(System.EventHandler{Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.RuntimeEventArgs},System.Object,Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.RuntimeEventArgs,System.Exception)
member.param: Handler to which the event is forwarded
member.returns: True is fault handled, false otherwise
member.remarks: Override to process forward exceptions

member.name: P:Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.IContextRule.FaultActions
member.summary: Actions to run if the rule execution fails

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Validator
member.summary: Reference implementation of the interface. This implementation keeps the validation rules in a map. It also adds the default set of validation rules defined in the reference implementation.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IValidator
member.summary: The IValidator interface defines a set of methods for validating untrusted input.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IValidator.IsValid(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether input is valid according to a given rule. The rule is determined by passing a rule name key, which is used to identify a particular ValidationRule object.
member.param: The rule name key to use for validation.
member.returns: True, if the data is valid. False, otherwise.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IValidator.AddRule(System.String,Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IValidationRule)
member.summary: Adds a rule object with the associated rule name key. This rule can be used to validate data later using the method.
member.param: The rule name key to use for the new rule.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IValidator.GetRule(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the rule object with the specified key.
member.param: The rule name key to lookuip.
member.returns: The object associated witht the rule name key

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IValidator.RemoveRule(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the rule object with the specified key.
member.param: The rule name key for the rule to remove

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.ValidationRules.PrintableValidationRule
member.summary: This class is for validating that text is valid printable ASCII characters.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.ValidationRules.PrintableValidationRule.IsValid(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the input is a valid printable character.
member.returns: True, if the input is valid. False, otherwise.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.Actions.BlockAction.Execute(Owasp.Esapi.Runtime.ActionArgs)
member.remarks: Will end the current request

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Encoder
member.summary: Reference implementation of the IEncoder interface.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncoder
member.summary: The IEncoder interface contains a number of methods related to encoding input so that it will be safe for a variety of interpreters.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncoder.Canonicalize(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method performs canonicalization on data received to ensure that it has been reduced to its most basic form before validation. The application can supply a list of codecs and the data will be decoded by each codec cosecutively, until it has reached its canonical form.
member.param: The names of the codecs to use for canonicalization. These codecs will be used in order.
If this is true, then double encodings will cause an exception.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncoder.Canonicalize(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.param: If true double encoding causes exception

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncoder.Normalize(System.String)
member.summary: Reduce all non-ascii characters to their ASCII form so that simpler validation rules can be applied. For example, an accented-e character will be changed into a regular ASCII e character.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncoder.Encode(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method encodes the input according to the given codec name.
member.param: The codec to use to encode the input.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncoder.Decode(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method decodes the input according to the given codec name.
member.param: The codec to use to decode the input.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncoder.GetCodec(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns the codec associated with the given codec name.
member.returns: The codec associated with the codec name.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncoder.AddCodec(System.String,Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.ICodec)
member.summary: This method adds the given codec with the given codec name to the Encoder.
member.param: The name of the codec to add.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncoder.RemoveCodec(System.String)
member.summary: This method removes the codec with the given codec name.
member.param: The name of the codec to remove.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.ICodec
member.summary: The ICodec interface defines a set of methods for encoding and decoding application level encoding schemes, such as HTML entity encoding and percent encoding (aka URL encoding).

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.ICodec.Encode(System.String)
member.summary: Decode a String that was encoded using the encode method in this Class.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.ICodec.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decode a String that was encoded using the encode method in this Class.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Codecs.XmlCodec.Decode(System.String)
member.remarks: This method is not implemented.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessReferenceMap
member.summary: The IAccessReferenceMap interface is used to map from a set of internal direct object references to a set of indirect references that are safe to disclose publicly. This can be used to help protect database keys, filenames, and other types of direct object references.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessReferenceMap.GetIndirectReference(System.Object)
member.summary: Get a safe indirect reference to use in place of a potentially sensitive direct object reference.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessReferenceMap.GetDirectReference(System.String)
member.summary: Get the original direct object reference from an indirect reference. Developers should use this when they get an indirect reference to translate it back into the real direct reference. If an invalid indirectReference is requested, then an AccessControlException is thrown.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessReferenceMap.GetIndirectReferences
member.summary: Returns a collection of the indirect object references.
member.returns: The collection of indirect object references.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessReferenceMap.GetDirectReferences
member.summary: Returns a collection of the direct object references.
member.returns: The collection of direct object references.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessReferenceMap.AddDirectReference(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a direct reference and a new random indirect reference, overwriting any existing values.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessReferenceMap.RemoveDirectReference(System.Object)
member.summary: Remove a direct reference and the corresponding indirect reference.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessReferenceMap.Update(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Update the refrences. This preserves any existing mappings for items that are still in the new list. You could regenerate new indirect references every time, but that might break anything that previously used an indirect reference, such as a URL parameter.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncryptor
member.summary: The IEncryptor interface provides a set of methods for performing common encryption, random number, and hashing operations. Implementors should take care to ensure that they initialize their implementation with a strong "master key", and that they protect this secret as much as possible.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncryptor.Hash(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the hash of the provided plaintext and salt. The salt helps to protect against a rainbow table attack by mixing in some extra data with the plaintext.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncryptor.Encrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts the provided plaintext and returns a ciphertext string.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncryptor.Decrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts the provided ciphertext string (encrypted with the encrypt method) and returns a plaintext string.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncryptor.Sign(System.String)
member.summary: Create a digital signature for the provided data and return it in a string.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncryptor.VerifySignature(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Verifies a digital signature (created with the sign method) and returns the bool result.
member.param: The data to verify the signature against.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncryptor.Seal(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a seal that binds a set of data and an expiration timestamp.
member.param: The timestamp of the expiration date of the data.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncryptor.Unseal(System.String)
member.summary: Unseals data (created with the seal method) and throws an exception describing any of the various problems that could exist with a seal, such as an invalid seal format, expired timestamp, or decryption error.
member.returns: The data if the seal was valid.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncryptor.VerifySeal(System.String)
member.summary: Verifies a seal (created with the seal method) and throws an exception describing any of the various problems that could exist with a seal, such as an invalid seal format, expired timestamp, or data mismatch.
member.returns: True, if the seal was valid. False, otherwise.

member.name: P:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IEncryptor.TimeStamp
member.summary: Gets a timestamp representing the current date and time to be used by other functions in the library.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.ValidationException
member.summary: A ValidationException should be thrown to indicate that the data provided by the user or from some other external source does not match the validation rules that have been specified for that data.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.ValidationException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of ValidationException.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.AccessReferenceMap
member.summary: Reference implementation uses short random strings to create a layer of indirection. Other possible implementations would use simple integers as indirect references.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.AccessReferenceMap.#ctor(System.Collections.ICollection)
member.summary: Constructor that accepts collection of direct references.
member.param: The collection of direct references to initialize the access reference map.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.MatchHelper.WildcardToRegex(System.String)
member.summary: Convert wildcard match string to a regex

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.ISecurityConfiguration
member.summary: The ISecurityConfiguration interface stores all configuration information that directs the behavior of the ESAPI implementation.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.AccessController
member.summary: Reference implementation of the interface. It simply stores the access control rules in nested collections.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessController
member.summary:
The IAccessController interface defines a set of methods that can be used in a wide variety of applications to enforce access control. In most applications, access control must be performed in multiple different locations across the various application layers.
The interface is built around the idea of subjects, actions, and resources. A specific subject/action/resource combination is known as a rule.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessController.IsAuthorized(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the currently authenticated subject is authorized to perform a particular action to a particular resource.
member.param: The resource to perform the action on.
member.returns: True, if access is allowed. False, otherwise.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessController.IsAuthorized(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether a given subject is authorized to perform a particular action to a particular resource.
member.param: The subject who is performing the action.
The resource to perform the action on.
member.returns: True, if access is allowed. False, otherwise.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessController.AddRule(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an access control rule, defined as a subject, an action, and a resource.
member.param: The subject who is performing the action.
The resource to perform the action on.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.IAccessController.RemoveRule(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Removes an access control rule, defined as a subject, an action, and a resource. Throws an exception if rule
member.param: The subject who is performing the action.
The resource to perform the action on.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.ValidationRules.DateValidationRule.IsValid(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the input is a valid date.
member.returns: True, if the input is valid. False, otherwise.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.IntrusionDetector
member.remarks: This implementation monitors EnterpriseSecurityExceptions to see if any user exceeds a configurable threshold in a configurable time period. For example, it can monitor to see if a user exceeds 10 input validation issues in a 1 minute period. Or if there are more than 3 authentication problems in a 10 second period. More complex implementations are certainly possible, such as one that establishes a baseline of expected behavior, and then detects deviations from that baseline.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.IntrusionDetector.AddException(System.Exception)
member.summary: This implementation uses an exception store in each User object to track exceptions.

member.summary: Adds the event to the IntrusionDetector.

member.summary: The ILogger interface defines a set of methods that can be used to log events.

member.summary: Log a fatal event if 'fatal' level logging is enabled.

member.summary: Log a fatal level security event if 'fatal' level logging is enabled and also record the stack trace associated with the event.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Interfaces.ILogger.IsFatalEnabled
member.summary: Allows the caller to determine if messages logged at this level will be discarded, to avoid performing expensive processing.
member.returns: true, if fatal level messages will be output to the log.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.IntegrityException
member.summary: An IntegrityException should be thrown when a problem with the integrity of data has been detected. For example, if a financial account cannot be reconciled after a transaction has been performed, an integrity exception should be thrown.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.IntegrityException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of IntegrityException.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Encryptor
member.summary: Reference implementation of the IEncryptor interface. This implementation layers on the .NET provided cryptographic package. Algorithms used are configurable in the configuration file.

member.summary: Creates a seal that binds a set of data and an expiration timestamp.
member.param: The timestamp of the expiration date of the data.

member.name: P:Owasp.Esapi.Encryptor.TimeStamp
member.summary: Gets a timestamp representing the current date and time to be used by other functions in the library.

member.summary: Assert request is secure (over SSL and using POST)

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.LogLevels
member.summary: These are fields for the logger class.

member.name: F:Owasp.Esapi.LogLevels.FATAL
member.summary: Only fatal log messages are recorded.

member.name: F:Owasp.Esapi.LogLevels.ERROR
member.summary: Only error-level log messages are recorded.

member.name: F:Owasp.Esapi.LogLevels.WARN
member.summary: Only warning-level log messages are recorded.

member.name: F:Owasp.Esapi.LogLevels.INFO
member.summary: Only informational log messages are recorded.

member.name: F:Owasp.Esapi.LogLevels.DEBUG
member.summary: Only debug log messages are recoreded.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.LogLevels.ParseLogLevel(System.String)
member.summary: This method parses the string indiciating log level and returns the appropriate integer.
member.param: The string indicating the log level.
member.returns: The integer representing the log level.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.LogEventTypes
member.summary: This class contains the keys for the different event types that can be passed to the logger.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Logger
member.summary: Reference implementation of the interface. This implementation uses the Log4Net logging package, and marks each log message with the currently logged in user and the word "SECURITY" for security related events.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Logger.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The constructor, which is hidden (private) and accessed through Esapi class.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Logger.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The constructor, which is hidden (private) and accessed through Esapi class.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Logger.GetLogMessage(System.Int32,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Log the message after optionally encoding any special characters that might inject into an HTML based log viewer. This method accepts an exception.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.ValidationRuleAttribute
member.remarks: Marks a class as a validation rule; the class has to implement IValidationRule

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.IntrusionException
member.summary: An IntrusionException should be thrown anytime an error condition arises that is likely to be the result of an attack in progress. IntrusionExceptions are handled specially by the IntrusionDetector, which is equipped to respond by either specially logging the event, logging out the current user, or invalidating the current user's account.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.IntrusionException.#ctor
member.summary: Internal classes may throw an IntrusionException to the IntrusionDetector, which generates the appropriate log message.

member.name: M:Owasp.Esapi.Errors.IntrusionException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of IntrusionException.

member.name: T:Owasp.Esapi.CodecAttribute
member.remarks: Marks a class as a codec; the class has to implement ICodec interface
